titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يُذْبَحُ فِي الْحَرَمِ وَ مَا يُخْرَجُ بِهِ مِنْهُ
titles.en: Chapter 20 – What can be slaughtered inside the Al-Harram and what one came come out with, from it

titles.ar: بَابُ صَيْدِ الْحَرَمِ وَ مَا تَجِبُ فِيهِ الْكَفَّارَةُ
titles.en: Chapter 21 – Hunt of the Al-Harram and what expiation is Obligated with regards to it
Chapter 19 – A tree of the Al-Harram

titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يُذْبَحُ فِي الْحَرَمِ وَ مَا يُخْرَجُ بِهِ مِنْهُ
titles.en: Chapter 20 – What can be slaughtered inside the Al-Harram and what one came come out with, from it

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/83)

parts.text: أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يُذْبَحُ بِمَكَّةَ إِلَّا الْإِبِلُ وَ الْبَقَرُ وَ الْغَنَمُ وَ الدَّجَاجُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abu Nasr, from Abdul Kareem, from Abu Baseer,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Nothing can be slaughtered in Makkah except for the camel, and the cow, and the sheep, and the chicken’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn abu Nasr from ‘Abd al-Karim from abu Basir who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘It is prohibited to slaughter any animal in Makkah except camels, cows, sheep and chickens.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/83)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَا كَانَ يَصُفُّ مِنَ الطَّيْرِ فَلَيْسَ لَكَ أَنْ تُخْرِجَهُ وَ مَا كَانَ لَا يَصُفُّ فَلَكَ أَنْ تُخْرِجَهُ
قَالَ وَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ دَجَاجِ الْحَبَشِ قَالَ لَيْسَ مِنَ الصَّيْدِ إِنَّمَا الصَّيْدُ مَا طَارَ بَيْنَ السَّمَاءِ وَ الْأَرْضِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Ammar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whatever from the birds which arrays (its wings in flight), so it is not for you that you exit it, and whatever was not arraying (its wings in flight), so it is for you that you exit it’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘And I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the Ethiopian chicken (Turkey). He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is not from the hunts. But rather the hunt is what flies between the sky and the earth’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Of the birds that which flaps its wings in flight is prohibited to be taken out; but you can take out that which does not flap its wings in flight.’ I then asked him (the Imam) about the Ethiopian chicken. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not hunting a prey. Hunting a prey is that which flies between the sky and earth.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/84)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ

text: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَنَا حَاضِرٌ عَنِ الدَّجَاجِ الْحَبَشِيِّ يُخْرَجُ بِهِ مِنَ الْحَرَمِ فَقَالَ إِنَّهَا لَا تَسْتَقِلُّ بِالطَّيَرَانِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Jameel Bin Darraj, from Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> was asked, and I was present, about the Ethiopian chicken (Turkey), coming out with it from the Al-Harram. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It does no fly around with the birds’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Jamil ibn Darraj from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was asked, when I was present, about the Ethiopian chicken if it can be taken out of al-Haram (the sacred area). He (the Imam) said, ‘Its flight is not independent.’”
